title: City watchdog investigates 'lottery investment' firm touting 125pc returns
text:
A firm which offered investors 125pc returns in as little as six months faces an investigation by the City watchdog for its outlandish claims and confusing marketing.

Watchlotto, which offers its users the chance to win high-end watches in lottery-style prize draws, has been seeking new investors for its business. In return for investments of £10,000 or more, backers would see huge returns on their money.

The firm's advertising boasted of approval by the City watchdog, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA). However, Watchlotto is not listed on the FCA’s register of authorised firms, meaning the watchdog has not given its investment scheme the greenlight.
